basics_of_neural_network.name: Basic of Neural Network
description: Basics of Neural Network section covers the mathematics and mechanics of Feed Forward Neural Network - the building blocks for Deep Learning.
1. Demonstrate the mathematics and mechanics behind neural network and gradient descent
2. Comparison between Traditional ML and Neural Network
3. Solving classic classification problem with NN approach
4. Building a basic PyTorch Trainer/Learner using Python classes with basic PyTorch training workflow

notebook.name: Understanding Gradient Descent
notebook.description: Gradient Descent is an iterative machine learning technique on optimization of neural network for ML problem. This note book contains basic steps for gradient descent to resolve a simple linear regression problem using PyTorch

notebook.name: Introduction to Neural Network
notebook.description: PyTorch implimentation from basic percentron to multi-layer feed-forward neural network with non-linear activation functions

notebook.name: Introduction to PyTorch Workflow
notebook.description: Simplified PyTorch workflow for ML training with Python class building for training/validation steps

notebook.name: Classification with Neural Network
notebook.description: Neural Network classification model and a comparison to other ML classification algorithm

computer_vision.name: Computer Vision
description: Computer Vision section covers various CV applications and techniques
1. Building and understanding simple convsolutional neural network from scratch to resolve classic computer vision dataset
2. Understanding and Training of various modern computer vision architecture
3. Using Transfer Learning Technique for custom dataset
4. Understanding Object Detection technique by going through RCNN family and SSD

notebook.name: Neural Network on MNIST
notebook.description: Building a simple convolutional neural network for solving MNIST dataset classification with 99% accuracy

notebook.name: LeNet-5 on EMNIST
notebook.description: LeNet-5 on EMNIST and visualising the feature maps through hooks
